pageContext.claim: “Virtually, every leading Democrat, has pledged to entirely eliminate American production of oil, clean coal, natural gas.”
pageContext.analysis: Democrats have been skeptical of fracking and some on the left have urged weaning off fossil fuels, especially coal. But they have not pledged to eliminate U.S. production of oil or natural gas. (As we've noted, there is no such thing as "clean coal.") Democratic presidential candidates for the 2020 nomination have a wide variety of stances on climate policy. Five supporting banning fossil fuel exports, but the majority of the field either doesn't support that move or haven't made their position clear.
